WRITING.TEXT:
I just got tickets to the River City Music Festival in Omaha to go see Matisyahu on the 18th.
If anybody else is a fan, I thought I'd [share the link for tickets here!](https://on.spingo.com/e/live_entertainment?cc=go-reddit)

June 18th - [River City Music Festival](https://on.spingo.com/e/live_entertainment?cc=go-reddit) - Sokol Park. $59
George Clinton, Matisyahu, Keller Williams

If I were LeBron, I would leave. This team looks like garbage. Kyrie isn't a winner. Cleveland wasn't good while he was the main star. Love isn't a winner either. His Minnesota teams were awful.
LeBron is the only real winner on the team.
No idea. But if you think about it, Minnesota wasn't good with Love, Cleveland wasn't good with just Irving - LeBron is still the only winner on the team.
How is it that the Warriors have all of the best shooters in the NBA on the same team?
I agree with this 100%. But that's what makes good business partnerships!
I don't like the change. It makes sense for pictures to be posted chronologically. If there are peoples posts that I don't want to see, I will simply stop following them.

While I get what you are saying, I don't necessarily agree. I feel a lot of startups attract talent because it is a way to make big money fast.
And it doesn't always take lots of experience to be successful. As proved by companies like [Snapchat](http://techcrunch.com/gallery/a-brief-history-of-snapchat/), Facebook, etc.

Let me clarify.
There are many people out there who have good ideas, but don't quite know how to take the first step. I am hoping this will be a place where they connect with people who **do** know how to do those things that you mentioned.
It's really no different from other entrepreneurs who just start out with an idea and learn as they go.
I am hoping to overcome my fear and quit my job, sell my car, and start my own business. Fear keeps telling me that I'll never make it, but I just have to go for it.

I have been looking at finding remote work as well, and it has been difficult for me. I am currently working for a company, but would enjoy the ability to work from anywhere in the world.
I would love to hear advice on how to do this. I also feel like a jack-of-all-trades as it goes to marketing.
